sburjan - (11:28): .  
flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 11:32  
flaviusolaru - (11:34): Hi guys, i have an issue with XE 2.3... i created a wiki macro that has a problem...$context.macro.content returns null  
flaviusolaru - (11:34): do i need programming rights for wiki macros?  
flaviusolaru - (11:34): may that's why it doesn't work...  
flaviusolaru - (11:35): the same wiki macro worked in XE 2.2.6  
flaviusolaru - (11:48): tested on a localhost with 2.3 and it worked... hmm and yet on myxwiki.org didn't

florinciu left at 17:49 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:23): Anyone have any thoughts about adding Javascript style dom manipulation methods to the XDOM object?  
sdumitriu - (18:24): I'd like that  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:24): If I'm not mistaken, script is a transformation and thus runs before rendering so the xdom can be edited by script.  
sdumitriu - (18:24): Yep  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:25): Being able to insert user supplied content as "plain text" or "no macros" would be a big security improvement.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:26): Is that how interface extensions are intended to work?  
sdumitriu - (18:28): Yeah, kind of  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:28): As opposed to extending XHTML that is.  
arkub joined #xwiki at 18:29  
sdumitriu - (18:32): abusenius: The new patch contains only the tests  
abusenius - (18:33): ups  
abusenius - (18:34): look now  
sdumitriu - (18:35): vmassol1: What's your take for unit tests, fewer methods with many checks inside, or more methods each with one specific check?  
sdumitriu - (18:38): abusenius: Looks good, I'll apply them  
abusenius - (18:40): great  
vmassol1 - (18:42): sdumitriu: lots of simple tests (for unit tests)  
vmassol1 - (18:42): ie specific checks
